website_summaries.verdict: A high-quality exercise ball that is far cheaper than its competitors.
pros: A sturdy, scent-free ball that works for exercising or as a chair
The included pump is easy to use
cons: Some customers reported that their balls popped after a few months of use

customer_reviews.title: Got me through a long natural labor and puts baby to sleep!
customer_reviews.text: I used this while in labor with my second child. I had a long labor that lasted over 24 hours and it provided such incredible relief at home. By the time I decided I couldn’t handle the contractions at home (24 hours from the start of labor) I was 8cm! I got on the birthing center ball and really didn’t like their ball! Wish I took mine with me lol. Now it’s like my babies sleep kryptonite. No matter how fussy he may get, if I bounce on the ball holding him he clonks right out! This ball has gotten so much use and held up so well. I absolutely love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Great price! Very solid product!
customer_reviews.text: This is as simple as it gets. A great product for a great price. The ball comes in a small box and extra 'stoppers' (plastic piece that stops the air flow), a stopper remover, and even a two-way hand pump. The ball is very solid and very comfortable. The material provides a nice grip, so you don't feel like you're slipping all over the place. If you're doing core work, I suggest you fill it up more than you think.. you want just a little bit of 'give' so you can get the best core workout. Pros: Great materials Extra items included Air stays in longer even after heavy workouts Great price Cons: None. This is the one to buy!
customer_reviews.author: KingOfAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome so far!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for sciatic pain while pregnant. It causes so much tingling and numbness in my legs that I cannot sleep. I’ve had this for a few days now, and sitting on it for a few minutes before bed has helped so much! I haven’t used it for labor yet, so I’m not sure how that will go, but excited to find out. I tried to get as close to an accurate color with the photo as I could. I purchased the blue, 65 cm ball. It’s not as bright blue as the photo shows, it’s more muted.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Roose

customer_reviews.title: This stability ball is far better quality than the one I already had
customer_reviews.text: This stability ball is far better quality than the one I already had. The material seems thicker and sturdier. It comes with a great hand pump (quiet, and no chirping like the cheaper models, and it inflates the ball very quickly). **please note: the ball will not fully inflate on the first pumping-up. let it rest for a day and then top it off** Definitely would purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Ballard

customer_reviews.title: This ball is great. My husband and I are not small people ...
customer_reviews.text: This ball is great. My husband and I are not small people and we can both sit on it comfortably without fear of it popping. It feels stable and holds air well. After we initially inflated it and used it, we did have to add more air once the ball had stretched a bit but it has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, bargain price!
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the quality of this ball. Some of the others I looked at were upwards of $80. I can't afford that right now. I was just diagnosed with fibromyalgia, degenerative disc disease and herniated discs. I needed a ball to do safe exercises at home between my physical therapy appointments. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone. It is well made and easy to inflate, and definitely the right price. I will be buying a smaller version in the near future. Thank you for an inexpensive quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Jodi B.

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy quality and perfect size.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'9". Perfect size to use as an exercise ball. I saw some reviews that said this was too short for someone around my size...that is only the case of you intend to use it as a chair at a desk. Otherwise, for working out, the size chart is spot on. For a chair, always size up. ;)
customer_reviews.author: C Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Read about my BALL
customer_reviews.text: If you need an exercise ball this might be the ball for you. It's easy to inflate with the given pump. Good sturdy material. Takes a good amount of weight. Ball has a good bounce to it, very good to do situps and stretches on. Perfect for home workouts. I would recommend a non slip flooring to keep the ball sturdy. With so many choices out there I'm very happy with my purchase. Hope this was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Joon yi

customer_reviews.title: She wants to sue for selling bad product.
customer_reviews.text: Product faulty for ball exploded while my wife was using it and she fell hard on floor hurting her entire body and is in pain from her toe all the way up to her neck. She wants to sue for selling bad product.
customer_reviews.author: murphy

customer_reviews.title: Product AND Seller are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: About the product: I have a larger one that we use as a seat for a fidgety homeschooler. It's perfect for him and withstands the rough housing of a 10-year-old boy and his rambunctious little sister. Ordered one for her because she loves using it, too. About the seller: originally ordered the wrong size. Would have cost $8 to return it. Emailed the seller and they graciously refunded me. (Probably wouldn't have been worth restocking it.) Correct size is coming tomorrow and kids are happy.👍
customer_reviews.author: online shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ball
customer_reviews.text: This ball is awesome. I got it for my son to use in class. The third grade teacher allows the kids to sit on exercise balls instead of chairs if they want. I noticed some of the other kids and they rubber seems much thinner. This one is so strong and sturdy! My son loves it and says he has the best ball. Supposedly the other kids agree. Lol
customer_reviews.author: KeriT

customer_reviews.title: HAPPILY BOUNCING!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 75cm ball, for my height (5'4") I thought I needed extra space with the ball, clearly I misjudged but still love the ball. Seems very durable and strong! I've already tried to put all my weight on it, and bounced on it. I am currently around 200lbs, and I felt very confident that it was strong enough to go the distance, great product at great price. I also got lots of exercises to do on it, in the box, and they emailed me a new set of workouts to try.
customer_reviews.author: SunshineGal77

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool and works great for an office chair - just ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks cool and works great for an office chair - just don't pump it up around co workers (it's a little embarrassing) haha
customer_reviews.author: Blake Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Not Strong Enough For Me
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 exercise balls in 3 different sizes from 3 different manufacturers, and this is the only one i do not like. At first i though it was just slowly leaking air. It would be firm after you pumped it up, but then it would go down a few inches after a day or two. But now i don't think it is leaking but the rubber is just to thin and stretchy to hold its firmness. In other words the rubber gives to much. I will not buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: jamie21

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Return Pricing
customer_reviews.text: Well it has multiple sizes and I went with the size and height of my wife. Ball arrived and is very small. Not something she could use to sit on while working. That being said, i went to do a return to get a bigger size and shipping was half the cost of my item. So, i either lose money just returning it or I love all of my money with a product that doesn't work. Beware. If you want to use this to sit on...I would avoid it or go with the biggest size possible. Just remember, if you dont like it and have to return you're going to get hosed.
customer_reviews.author: mgroman

customer_reviews.title: Great ball!
customer_reviews.text: The tools that came with this ball are wonderful, especially the tool for getting the plug out of the ball, I also like the color selection because my last ball was purple and I don't like purple. My mom was a pediatric physical therapist and always had an excersise ball for the kids she treated in the back of her car, so I have been using them in several ways my whole life. My husband uses the ball to help with his neck and shoulder pain. I highly recommend this ball from this maker, a great deal and everything you need including extra plugs and a pump come included!
customer_reviews.author: JillHdz

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Ball feels thin and flimsy. Wish it was firmer like the ones I use in PT. Update. I took it to PT with me. They told me not to use it. When inflated to proper firmness it is more like an 80+ cm ball. If I can deflate it, I will return it It is either the wrong size, or it is junk.
customer_reviews.author: thomas fox

customer_reviews.title: The ball is too small, not as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: The ball is much smaller than described. The 85 cm is the circumference of the ball, not the diameter which is not mentioned anywhere. I was going to use this ball as a chair, but it is WAY to small to be of any use whatsoever. Very dissappointed! In addition the pump is horrible, it barely worked in the beginning, and stopped functioning about half way through inflation.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Careful -- it's not antiburst
customer_reviews.text: I got this in December 2016 and use it at the office as my only desk chair -- and find it very comfortable. However it burst on me the other day for apparently no reason -- sending me crashing to the floor and seriously bruising my hip. Balls like this are suppose to include a feature that makes them deflate slowly in the case of a burst. Good news is Amazon gave me a full refund. I've had these products before so decided to chalk this up to a one-off defect -- and took the plunge to try it again. Time will tell...
customer_reviews.author: suziq24

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance ball
customer_reviews.text: Very reasonably priced and received it two days after purchase. Exactly what I wanted. Took it to my gym for inflating and one of the guys commented on what a GOOD quality ball it is. Looking forward to working out with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Run small for use as a desk chair. but quality is great!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this ball. The color was great and it seemed super strong! I bought this size 65 ball to use as a chair. I followed the guidelines for "chair" but found it was WAY too small for that purpose. The desk came to my upper chest. The next recommended size was 75--but that would have been to small too. My neighbor uses a size 85 ball, I brought it to my office and it was perfect. My desk is not unusually high...its normal sized. Sadly, this company did not have any fun colors in 85 so I returned my ball and ordered elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great value for sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: I am currently having physical therapy for my lower back and right leg. My therapist told me to order my own exercise ball to use at home. After reading all of the reviews, I chose this one. It is easy to inflate and can hold a lot of weight. I am pleased with the quality and love the pink color!
customer_reviews.author: Judith Price

customer_reviews.title: Ball can Burst open
customer_reviews.text: This ball burst for an 180lb man. It is not anti-burst.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Tall-people friendly; cats, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: Keep away from cats. The foam casing doesn’t hold up to even small clawpoints. That said, it worked well for its price before “the encounter”. I got it initially because a 55cm ball was too small for my exercise ball chair at work (I’m 6’)...65 is a comfortable size for my leg length (34” inseam) on a chair frame, but too tall for an average desk, so I brought it home instead. Recommendation: fill it with about two cups of playground sand or .177 bb’s so that it won’t drift away anytime you hop off it. If I remember, I will update this after I’ve attempted to repair it post-“encounter”.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie+Casey

customer_reviews.title: Product Description of the size doesn't match the size of the actual ball
customer_reviews.text: The product description and the packaging clearly stated that it was supposed to be a 65CM ball. However, the ball in the box was a 55CM. We assumed that this was just a shipping error, so we returned the order and placed a new order. The 2nd order came with a 55CM ball too.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Size is NOT correct!
customer_reviews.text: Beware. The sizing is NOT accurate. While the ball is stamped as being a 65cm it is not. It is 55cm at full inflation. It also states on the package that extra plugs and a plug remover are included. They are not. I would like to return this but I cannot get the plug out to deflate it. Contacted the company but no reply. VERY disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Sussie and Gunny.

customer_reviews.title: URBNFit 65 cm
customer_reviews.text: Received item easy to blow up and the ball is sturdy can get a lifetime warranty for free just for registering. I would recommend for purchase. Having problem trying to figure out what size to choose we’ll here is some help. I went with 65cm and I am 5”4 and I weight a considerable amount 230 but I like large. Exercise ball diameter—-Person's height 55 cm 5'1"– 5'8" 65 cm 5'9"– 6'2" 75 cm 6'3"– 6'7" 85 cm 6'8" and taller
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Nice, tough small ball.
customer_reviews.text: I get so worn out hearing people buying these ball(all sizes) based only on their height. Height is a factor, but only one, I'm 6'2" and I bought this small ball for HIGHER EFFORT and range of motion. Truth is, anybody can use almost any size ball, larger is easier with less load and range of motion, and more support/stability. Smaller the opposite. If you're heavy, or doing dumbbell presses on the ball, go with a bigger one, because it's safer. Just like bigger tires on a truck, they support more weight with less chance of bursting. But I digress, like I said, nice tough small ball.
customer_reviews.author: A. Noid

customer_reviews.title: The pump made it very easy to inflate
customer_reviews.text: I just recently received the exercise ball, but have found that it is as billed. The pump made it very easy to inflate, and it seems to hold the air well. I use it primarily for a desk chair and the material makes it so it is easy to stay on and not slide around.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Guyant

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This ball was a little smaller than I expected it to be (totally my fault) but it has turned out to be PERFECT. I really like the material it is made of, it's a nice thick quality with plenty of stretch. I've used it for sitting on at the desk and I've used it for all of my workouts. Inflation was super easy and the wrinkles from shipping are pretty much gone now. No funky smells, it's a nice soft material not the sticky shiny stuff some are made of, and I bought white and totally dig the pearly hue. I'll definitely buy from these guys again.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth N.

customer_reviews.title: Epic Preggo Relief for Hip/Back Pain
customer_reviews.text: Best pregnancy purchase by far. Our boy lives low so I constantly felt like I was being split like a pistachio shell. The moment I sat on this was INSTANT relief. I use this to do laundry, to do prenatal yoga, to watch TV- it takes the pressure right off my hips. My husband loves to stretch out his back on it. Feels sturdy. Easy to inflate. I'll be buying again to give to pregnant friends who don't yet know the power of the yoga ball. Edit: baby was born and I still use this all the time. Sometimes the only way to him to sleep is by holding him and bouncing rhythmically on this ball. Thoroughly enjoyed this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sera

customer_reviews.title: pump broke halfway through first inflation
customer_reviews.text: i was excited to get this. it looks great, and it's true, there's no ugly smell, just a faint aroma. but the pump broke when the ball was only halfway inflated. the handle popped right off on the upswing, and where i can fit it together there is grease, and no way to make it stay attached. so here i am with a half-pumped ball and a broken pump, and feeling pretty disappointed. i don't want to return the whole thing, i just want a new pump.
customer_reviews.author: harriett

customer_reviews.title: sizing is off. The 65 cm is actually 55 at best.
customer_reviews.text: We were replacing a 65 cm ball of a different brand. We wanted a 65 cm because that is what we need. When you pump this "65 cm" ball up it is noticeably smaller than the previous ball which was accurately sized. Using a tape measure it is only 54 cm across and 172 cm in circumference. (again 55 cm not 65 cm). I rarely send things back to amazon but I may pack this up and send it back. Why the heck can't the seller just be honest and state the sizes correctly. Do they assume no one will actually measure the ball? What is the point of having a size chart if the ball is inaccurately sized anyway?
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Cannot inflate it fully
customer_reviews.text: I can't blow it up the last few inches! Very frustrating. As a result, it's slightly too soft for me - firm to the touch but softer than the balls at my gym always were and therefore slightly less stable - harder to balance myself on it. (I guess that's good for my core!) But I'm happy to have it and have all kinds of exercises that I'm using with it. Plus I was able to get one in purple, which made me quite happy. I just use it for working out - strength training and core work - so I can't speak to uses in pain relief or pregnancy.
customer_reviews.author: lidlone

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5'2" and this is TO SMALL for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the reviews saying it would fit a person that is 5'2", I'm five-two and it was WAY to small for me to use at work. I wanted to use this at my desk since I'm 8 months pregnant I needed this because the office chairs are so uncomfortable. The ball itself actually seems to be good quality but its just way to small to use in an office. The customers saying that its not to small must not be using it for work, or not using it as a birthing ball. Anyway will be retuning - to small and does not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Allow 24 hours for true shape to set in
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to order this ball based off of some of the negative reviews, however mine came in in the right size and I am happy. I ordered the pearl color, it isn’t a glittery as the advertised photo, but it is pretty. It’s a cream color with glitter specs, I attached a photo next to my white bedding. You can’t see the glitter specs in the photo but the color is good. It appeared lopsided at first but upon putting more air in, and being patient, the ball expanded to a normal size. I’ve only had it blown up for 5 or so hours and I’m waiting on the lines from the packaging to disappear.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Charging double the money
customer_reviews.text: All right the ball arrived and it is ok to use except that the smell initially was intense. I have been using it and it works fine. The reason I gave this such low rating is because I feel being used as this same thing is available elsewhere for half the price. I wanted to give it 1 star but decided against it as I did buy it and price was listed up front. I guess I am the big fool here.
customer_reviews.author: KingKong

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Amazing Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I got the the stability ball that the chart said would be good for my height, but for my purposes it didn’t work as I wanted to use it as a chair for my home work station. I contacted the seller looking for the best way to exchange it since I got it on a lightning deal and wanted to keep the deal. The seller didn’t hesitate to ask what color and size I wanted and shipped me out a new one the next day. Both were easy to inflate and are of good quality. Will definitely purchase from the seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Bock

customer_reviews.title: ... it if inflated through the proper size it is pretty much flat and you can push your hand almost ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not come out to be the correct centimeter size when it has the proper amount of air in it if inflated through the proper size it is pretty much flat and you can push your hand almost all the way through it. Once inflated to the proper size it is roughly 10 centimeters larger diameter then the box says, I ordered a 55 and a 65 centimeter ball and they ended up being about 65 and 75 cm with the proper amount of air.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wrong sizing! Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: These have wrong sizing. Ordered 85cm, and received 65. It did say 85 on it however. 1. Yes I inflated it completely with my electric inflator. It would burst if I went for more. 2. Yes I know how to calculate diameter from circumference. 3. I do have another 65 cm ball that looks just like this one aka “85” cm one. I tried to let the company know that they sell faulty products, they didn’t seem to understand the issue. I sent it back. Ordered another one from Pro Body Pilates here on Amazon, and it indeed is 85 cm.
customer_reviews.author: Ksenia O Burova

customer_reviews.title: I bought this as an alternative chair
customer_reviews.text: I have found that it works quite well, it is stable enough to be on the computer as long a I need to in a day and it also gives me better circulation for my legs. I feel very comfortable on it and I don't feel like it will pop easy. I was worried about getting one that is not very strong and popping it, due to my size, so I got the same one my mom had, and I am pleased to say that though she bought hers several years ago, the one I just bought seems to be of the same quality and strength.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Deformed Material!! AVOID!!
customer_reviews.text: This URBNFIT Exercise Ball is full of deformities, creases, markings and discoloration! Some marks run the full diameter of the ball. Most look (or are) melted into the plastic with a different texture Not something that will stretch out or diminish over time. It’s not used, it’s clearly just bad manufacturing!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: I love this ball!
customer_reviews.text: At 34 weeks pregnant I found out that my daughter was in breech position. My ob/gyn was trying to push for a c-section. I wanted to avoid a c-section and heard that sitting on this ball could help her turn. I felt silly sitting on this ball. I sat and moved around on it for a half hour and I felt a big movement in my belly. She had turned herself to head down! I was so relieved. I also sat and bounced on this ball while in labor. Now I'm using this ball to strengthen my core again and work on my postpartum belly. I'm glad I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: MamaMissy7

customer_reviews.title: Ball sizes are not right........ inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered the 65 cm and 75 cm, oddly enough the 65 cm is larger but feels less sturdy..... I'm pretty confused by the differences and I'm not really happy with it. I bought the blue 65 cm for me I'm currently 24 weeks pregnant and got to stretch and workout some and use closer to the time of delivery and thr 75 cm black one I got for my 6'4" 250lb husband and it definitely doesn't work for him very well. The inconsistencies are puzzling....
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee84

customer_reviews.title: Size is wildly incorrect. Stay away if you wanted a large ball.
customer_reviews.text: I inflated my 85cm ball to maximize size and found it only inflates to 65cm. Measured it's height, and then the diameter directly on the ball, which confirmed it only inflates to 65cm. The logo on the ball says 85cm, so I got the "correct" ball. I imagine it's just poor measurements on the companys part. I've seen other reviews where people say "just buy larger" to compensate, but I suggest you don't buy this ball at all if you wanted a large one.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Peralta

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy birth support ball for pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this per my OB’s recommendation to try a ball for pelvic pain relief at the end of pregnancy. It has really helped- being able to rock and bounce slightly is soothing- and I have been impressed with the quality for the price. The pump it comes with is not super powerful, so inflating took a few minutes, but it feels sturdy and resilient now that it’s set up. My kids and husband have played with it too, and it seems to be holding air well.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonReviews

customer_reviews.title: so so ball....defective pump
customer_reviews.text: The hand pump stopped working about half way through inflating the ball. It stopped pulling air in through the holes at the back of the pump, and the slider became harder and harder to use, eventually seizing up completely. If I didn't have a bicycle pump on hand with the appropriate inflation nozzle, I'd have been sending this ball back. It seems fairly sturdy once inflated, although I would have to agree with some of the other reviewers, it runs small, even when firmly inflated. With so many choices out there - I just wouldn't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Calliope57

customer_reviews.title: Requires some work
customer_reviews.text: Initially the ball is easy to inflate but to get the pressure up it becomes difficult. the reason is how quickly you have to pump to counteract the escaping air between pushes. It would also be helpful to know what the correct pressure should be. Being a ball it is inherently unstable, a stability ring would be a nice feature. Hard to say anything about pain relief as I didn't buy it to relieve pain but rather to help me stretch and exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Zdzislaw Nagengast

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE SMELL
customer_reviews.text: Very strong chemical smell that gave me an asthma attack as soon as I removed the plastic. I had to put it in the garage, and it is likely to be weeks or even months before I can use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 55cm larger than 65cm?!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the pink ball for about 1 year now (55cm). It is nice but I was wanting something a bit taller to sit at my desk with, SO I ordered the next size up. Same brand but a larger size (65cm). I pumped the ball up when I received it and BAM — no it didn’t pop. But the 65cm ball was SMALLER than the 55 cm. I pumped it pretty firm to see if that would help but even with the “larger” ball pumped quite firm, my partially deflated pink one is still a bit larger! I will return it and maybe even go up a size to see if I can get the size I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for distraction!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter while we are doing distance learning. She's 18 and lives with special needs and is having a hard time with distance learning and is developing some bad habits while sitting there so bouncing is a distraction for her hands while her brain focuses on her teacher. Also helps her bottom not fall asleep on the kitchen chair while she sits there for hours (; Very easy to inflate and she loves to bounce.
customer_reviews.author: bisalo

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise ball
customer_reviews.text: This ball doesn’t deflate at all. I have had it for a long time and use it 3 or 4 times per week. It is made of very nice durable material. The tool that came with the ball to inflate it with certainly works but we have a pump we use that is easier. There certainly is nothing wrong with the tool that comes with it but mine is faster. The color is nice too. If you are on the fence as to whether or not you should buy this ball, jump off that fence and buy it. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dodger26

customer_reviews.title: Great workout ball
customer_reviews.text: This worked out well. Got the ball and inflated it that day. It took a lot of pumps to fill it up and my wife questioned me on why my right arm seemed so big (the pumping motion, under other circumstances might make you get hair palms), but ultimately it’s nice that it came with a pump. I inflated it to a pretty firm pressure and I’ve been using it to great effect with my resistance bands. Affordable and a great addition to my stay-at-home COVID 19 workout routine.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Wynia

customer_reviews.title: 65 cm is 55 cm
customer_reviews.text: First black ball arrived. Box AND ball are labeled 65 cm which is what was ordered. Inflated. It maxes at 55 cm. Even let it sit for a few days to see if the material would relax and we could get more air in. Nope. Ordered a replacement. Same thing. We cannot get it inflated over 55 cm. Will return again.
customer_reviews.author: Luwanda

customer_reviews.title: It's an exercise ball...but it's a quality exercise ball
customer_reviews.text: Looking at exercise balls is like looking at many things on Amazon - there are just so many to choose from, it's almost like throwing a dart and hoping it sticks. based on reviews and the fact that this was backed by what appeared to be a quality company, I made my choice, and I'm happy I chose this brand. High quality, actual warranty and customer service. It works exactly like it's supposed to and I'm pleased with my purchase. You can buy this with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Teri 's fire

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Had this ball just over 2 years, using it for chest fly's and other non-impact type of exercises (back on ball) about twice a week. We have taken very good care of it, stored it safely, and kept it properly inflated. Air started leaking from a small hole in it (heard air escaping while doing chest fly exercise), and when we touched the area the thing just completely split. Super bummed!
customer_reviews.author: Amy DeBruyn "Amy D"

customer_reviews.title: Great for stretches - muscle injuries & stiffness
customer_reviews.text: I was in accident and injured my back. Since it was muscle& nerve pain, it was looking like it would take awhile to heal, and exercise hurt so it was difficult to rebuild the muscle. One day I remembered exercise balls! I got the Med. size. I'm 5'6 128 lbs. it is the perfect size. Between bi-monthly acupuncture appts. & using this ball for stretches and sitting for long periods of time; then graduating to push ups and more strenuous exercises. It actually helped cut my healing time in half.
customer_reviews.author: Zelda

customer_reviews.title: Nice weight and material
customer_reviews.text: I've had exercise balls in the past but they always leaked. I just had shoulder surgery and the PT guy suggested a ball for my home exercises. This model is a good weight, by that I mean the thickness of the material. My wife had to inflate because of my shoulder, but it has held air and it's been a few weeks since inflation. The included pump works well and it was nice to get a sheet with suggested exercises. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Philm

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I need it for, great company
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this ball for exercise and to use in place of my desk chair for part of the day now that I am working from home. It looks nice, works great. And is the perfect size for my desk (75 cm). It came with a manual pump, and inflating the ball was a better workout then you get most days, whew! But came with replacement plugs, a device to help you remove the plug if you need to add more air, and a few pages of workout ideas. I’m happy I purchased this ball!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the right size
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 105lbs and got the one recommended for me. NO it was like a little beach ball 😪 I had a blue one that I could sit on it was bigger. I would love one of those ..
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Air it out first, then it's great
customer_reviews.text: As I suspected, it had a very strong smell at first. I inflated it as much as I could and stored it outside for several days. Unfortunately it got below freezing and snowed on the ball... I was concerned that the cold or snow might damage it, but I brought it inside, and it's been working great! After a couple of weeks, the smell was no longer noticeable, and my family is surprised at how sturdy it is - it supports a ~200lb person just fine. And I enjoy the bright blue color.
customer_reviews.author: kit2

customer_reviews.title: Really sturdy and great for an office chair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use as a chair along with a stability base. Really happy with it. Took a while to inflate (although it wasn't hard) but other than that it's been great. I've got a smaller ball that I use for exercise and it isn't nearly as tough. Guess this will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: I got a Yoga Egg not a Yoga Ball
customer_reviews.text: This was the second Yoga ball I purchased from this company. I wanted to get a smaller pink ball for my 2 year old daughter to do Yoga with me. However I was very upset when I inflated the Yoga ball only to fins out that it was extremely lopsided and shaped like an oval. I ordered a Yoga "Ball" not a Yoga "Egg" . I messaged the company to rectify the issue and haven't gotten any response from them.
customer_reviews.author: James Stanislawski

customer_reviews.title: Air
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: (Initially I gave this product one star) I recently purchased this ball and I am disappointed because every day I need to pump air into it. But the seller reached out to me via email, apologizing for the previous issues with the first exercise ball I received and offered to send me a replacement. I have had the new ball for 30 day and it’s holding the air well. I haven’t had to add air to it. I use it as my desk chair. I am happy with the service I received and the quality of my new exercise ball.
customer_reviews.author: silvia reyes

customer_reviews.title: Smells horrible!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice ball and exactly what I wanted except it smells so awful. It’s permeated my whole apartment and it’s making me nauseous and giving me a headache. It’s Saturday before Easter so it has to stay here until Monday unless I throw it out. I’m hoping the smell will be gone by then but if it’s still this awful tomorrow I’m tossing it.
customer_reviews.author: sweetfornyc

customer_reviews.title: Nice ball but difficult to inflate
customer_reviews.text: The ball is good size and does its job. But, it is leaky - it does not go completely flat, but I can definitely tell it loses air so much so that I need to inflate it every two weeks. The inflation process is a pain - it is simply too difficult to remove the plug. The plastic tool provided for plug removal is so flimsy that every time I used it I was afraid of breaking it; I wish it were made of steel or a bit stronger kind of material.
customer_reviews.author: Starkid

customer_reviews.title: Save your time and money and get something better.
customer_reviews.text: Ball arrived and is very small.The ball is much smaller than described. Nooooo way this is a 65cm ball The URBNFIT Exercise Ball that was shipped to me also is full of deformities, creases, markings and discoloration! Some marks run the full diameter of the ball. What a waste of my money. Save your time and money and get something better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great yoga ball, much better, in fact, than the one I have been using for years and less expensive. It doesn’t slip on carpet or flooring, it’s thick and durable. I hadn’t noticed when I ordered this but it comes with a little pamphlet full of exercises and stretches that can be done with the ball. Great bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Starbuck65

customer_reviews.title: Same exercise ball used by my physical therapist!
customer_reviews.text: This is the exact same ball that my physical therapist's office uses. It's very easy to inflate and only takes a few minutes. I've been using it for the same exercises I did at my PT's office and it really helps my back a lot! If you have back problems, save your $$$ from PT visits. Just buy this ball and a nice yoga mat, then look up videos on youtube for "exercise ball back exercises" and you'll get the same great results. It also comes with a LIFETIME WARRANTY!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa K. McKee

customer_reviews.title: WHY DOES THE INFORMATION ABOVE SAY WEIGHT LIMIT 2000LBS BUT THE BOX I RECEIVED SAY 600LBS?
customer_reviews.text: PLEASE ANSWER THE ABOVE QUESTION. I BOUGHT THIS SPECIFICALLY FOR THAT REASON. I WEIGH 385. YES, AFTER USE, YOU WILL HAVE TO PUMP IT BACK UP. IT DOESNT COMPLETELY DEFLATE, BUT YOU WILL NEED TO REAPPLY AIR TO REGAIN FIRMNESS. THE BALL WILL TAKE A WHILE TO COMPLETELY FILL UP THE FIRST TIME YOU PUT AIR IN. THIS DOES NOT LOOK AS PROMISING AS I HAD HOPED. I BELIEVE AT MY WEIGHT, WITH CONTINUOUS USE, THIS WILL NOT SUSTAIN LONGEVITY.
customer_reviews.author: herb ballard

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'6" and the reference says to order the 65mm ball. Just received and inflated, and this is a joke....The ball is no bigger than for a child. I will be returning immediately.
customer_reviews.author: SYS

customer_reviews.title: Boing boing boing
customer_reviews.text: Me: horrific posture, back pain, neck pain, shoulder pain, chiro appointment every other week Me + ball: lessened pain, better posture, chiro every month Problem: not solved but getting better Ball: very sturdy, although you'll want to take two days to air it up fully. The included pump worked perfectly for me. Just took awhile to do all the work. I very steathly aired the thing up at work. Worth every minute of "hard" work. Bottom line: try it. Works your core and helps your posture. Probably not the cure-all but it's pretty darn close.
customer_reviews.author: J Zhou

customer_reviews.title: Hard to inflate, seems to lose some air over time, but does the job.
customer_reviews.text: It took about 15 minutes to properly inflate this huge thing. When I got it to where I wanted, I gave myself a back stretch and it was amazing. I use it for a few minutes everyday. The thing is that it seems to be losing air at a small pace regardless of the pin thats placed in there. So I'd had to puil the pin out, lose some air before I plug it in, and pump more air into it. I have to do this once a month. Other than that, I haven't used it as a chair or anything. Can't complain besides what I mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: JustAGuy

customer_reviews.title: Won’t stay fully inflated
customer_reviews.text: Bought one, had a leak. Returned for a second and it also doesn’t want to remain inflated. I have to pump up every couple of weeks. I have another ball that is the same brand that I pump up maybe two times a year. Who knows. Might be time to change brands.
customer_reviews.author: The Beard

customer_reviews.title: Don’t trust the size chart.
customer_reviews.text: The pump included is cheap and hard to use. I used my electric pump and it worked well. The ball seems to be a good quality material but it is way too small. I ordered according to the chart but it sinks way too low when I sit on it. It is painful to sit on. Will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Do not use the hand pump
customer_reviews.text: The hand pump barely worked. It would work well for a minute then wouldn't open unless I did very slow pull back on it, meanwhile the air I just put in is leaking out. I used it for at least an hour and gave up. I was at work because easier to transport. Took it home and took 1 minute to inflate to a solid stability with the air compressor. The ball itself is fine. The hand pump was terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Tenney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ball and company
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic ball and excellent customer service. They really care about their products and their customers. Works great! Supports my 230lb body. It did take a little more than expected pumping action but gets the job done. It comes with all kinds of information and videos on exercises you can do. See picture. I have bought others trying to save a few bucks but this ball is worth every penny. It comes with extra plugs (never needed ) and a tool to help remove the plug to add air.Air pump included. Other do not have all of these extras and some have a rubbery smell and this one does not. I will buy again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Hand Luke

customer_reviews.title: Measurements are a bit off
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this workout ball for myself. I am 5 ft short. I went by their measurements and this is what they sent me. Needless to say after a few laughs, this is def the wrong size. Great ball though. And easy to inflate Def sending back.
customer_reviews.author: NanaPatiann

customer_reviews.title: Best $16 ever spent- size up?
customer_reviews.text: Best $16 I've ever spent! I am 28 weeks pregnant and decided to give this a try. It really helps with my back/hip pain. I plan on using this after the baby to workout too. Not too slippery on the floor, I just make sure I am holding onto a table. I would definitely SIZE UP if you are looking to use this at a desk/table. I am 5’4, got the 65cm and I can barely use it at my dinner table so I definitely know it won’t work at my work desk which is higher.
customer_reviews.author: Clg23

customer_reviews.title: My go-to remedy for back pain
customer_reviews.text: What I like most about my new exercise ball is that it was so easy to order and quick to arrive. I jokingly told my husband that I would take more than the noted 2-3 minutes to inflate the ball. But alas! Even my hands, weakened by arthritis, had the ball filled and plugged in the suggested time. I discovered The exercise ball at physio therapy when I expressed a need to stretch my back after working on spine and neck issues. One simple movement using the exercise ball has become my go-to remedy for back pain.
customer_reviews.author: Laurelann

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Color
customer_reviews.text: We needed a pregnancy ball, and chose this ball after reading the reviews. Color was important to us, and at the time they had a lot of color options. We wanted a grey ball, but they kept sending us purple. The second time we tried to reorder, the box said grey, but there was a bright purple ball inside. Unfortunately, all of this was happening during the Coronavirus, so each order was taking two weeks to receive. We decided to go with a different company in order to get the ball before our kid’s birth. We never inflated it, so not sure about the quality of the ball.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Barklage

customer_reviews.title: This is my Second Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Instagram: lion_rose_music The first ball I purchased was pink and it lasted forever! I purchased this one because it would look a lot better in my office space. I’m super happy with this company because the quality is superb, they include the pump, and even some workouts that I can do while I’m on hold! Lol. I hope the pics included are helpful to you!
customer_reviews.author: Lion Rose Music

customer_reviews.title: Keep pumping...it may appear to be full..but then may have too much give when you first use it.
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with the product thus far. It takes more pumps than it looks like it needs. However, it is easy to add more air if needed. I mis read the info about the bands. I thought there was a combination of both closed bands and single bands. There are just closed included. They are well made and well marked. There should be an N/A choice above. I had not pain to begin with. So I tried to leave it blank...
customer_reviews.author: Nancy R

customer_reviews.title: Good product!!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to inflate with the hand-pump it comes with. It takes sometimes to inflate but it worth it. Im bouncing on it with no problem (170lbs). Been using to relieve my back pain and some other exercise and its been great. Not losing any air since i started to use it, which has been almost 6 months already.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Ngo

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Followed another reviewer’s recommendation to inflate it about 2/3 full (where it did look like it would be big enough), let it sit overnight to stretch, then inflated the rest of the way to full capacity. It’s perfect for use at my home desk, and easy for periodic stretch breaks. Great value for the money, since it also included a two way pump, plug remover, and extra plugs.
customer_reviews.author: jesteph3

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5'10 and the 75 cm size is right for me
customer_reviews.text: The product is as expected. I'm only writing this review because I spent a long time angsting over what size to buy: 5'10 seems to be the upper cutoff for the 65 cm size, but the lower cutoff for the 75 cm size, so it was hard to know which I should buy. I'm here to recommend the 75 cm size to other 5'10 inch people. Also, the graphic suggests that a 65 cm ball will be a better fit under a 28 inch-tall desk, but I am currently sitting on my 75 cm ball at a 27 inch-tall desk and the height feels perfectly comfortable... don't let that graphic be a deterrent to buying the size you need.
customer_reviews.author: Elyse

customer_reviews.title: I give it four stars because although it is easy to inflate
customer_reviews.text: I give it four stars because although it is easy to inflate, and the material seems durable (Only had it for a week or so), I don't like that it has a very stretchy structure. What I mean by that is, when you sit or lay on it, the material gives, so you sink down a lot toward the center of the ball. I like the exercise balls that have a stronger less flexible material so that when you sit on it, you don't sink. Yes, I put the maximum amount of air in it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Boone

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product, exactly as advertised, and above-and-beyond customer service.
customer_reviews.text: High-quality product with great service backing it up. I originally ordered the wrong size, totally my fault, but they were kind enough to credit the return postage fee when I reordered the correct size. Also appreciate that this comes with a pump (seems like many other competing products force to also buy a pump, unless you already have one that fits), several spare plugs, and a handy plug removal tool (I'll admit I had no clue what that was for, but eventually figured it out). The workout guide PDF and the printed tips/workout suggestions were well-done and helpful. I would highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: S.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Awesome Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly as described. It is easy to use, affordable, and durable. I love the print out of exercises to get you started as well. If you are interested in sitting on the ball at your desk, make sure you inflate it well. I think if I had to do over again, I would get one size up than suggested for my desk height. I am short and sit a little too low at my desk. Otherwise, I love this ball and am on it while working, exercising, and watching TV.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for lower back pain!
customer_reviews.text: I used one like this in therapy for lower back pain. I bought one for home so I could continue with stretches and strength building. What a life saver! You will buy according to your height NOT weight. I’m 5’5 190 Lbs. I was a little leary if it could hold me but it does...no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tranquil Wood By Dave

customer_reviews.title: Stability ball
customer_reviews.text: The stability ball is nice. But when they send it they send you a card that says claim your free gift... They give you a website to go to, and of course there’s no free gift available they just want you to fill out stuff to get you information. There was another product that I bought that did the same thing with some lash serum. It’s very annoying. But the ball itself is a good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Debi LN

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cat toy, fun til they pop it
customer_reviews.text: Great for exercise. Even more so, cats love it as a giant toy! Except, if your cat has claws, I’ve now gone through two of these as they puncture them rather quickly. But it’s funny to watch a cat push and chase a giant ball around!
customer_reviews.author: sdnelson11

customer_reviews.title: The pump is defective
customer_reviews.text: My manual pump was extremely difficult to use. After 1-3 pumps, it would get caught. I could manipulate it so that it would work again, but then it would repeatedly get caught again. It was awful. It took me 45 minutes of continued labor to finally pump up the ball to use. We passed the labor among household members; it was a team effort. A disappointment during this COVID quarantine, albeit small.
customer_reviews.author: Honest customer

customer_reviews.title: Wrong ball size--but keep pumping . . . .
customer_reviews.text: Update: seems I need to keep pumping. Evidently it's very balloon-like. It's up to 59 cm now so I have a bit of work to do but proof of concept is there. I bought the 65 cm ball (I'm 5'6"). The ball seemed great until I went to workout and it was clearly too small. On a tip from another review, I measured my ball and it turns out it's 55 cm. Waiting for the company to get back to me to swap it for the correct size. Will update this review based on their response.
customer_reviews.author: mama llama

customer_reviews.title: So Far, Excellent Exercise Companion
customer_reviews.text: In the very short time -- a little under two weeks -- I have used the ball, it has been a sturdy, resilient companion to my exercise daily. I feel very comfortable even sitting on it at 15 minutes or more at a time, which has not diminished the initial firm inflation to date. I will upgrade my assessment, of course, if the quality of the ball itself should diminish or if its deterioration should affect the quality of my exercise. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Grace L.

customer_reviews.title: bouncy red office chair
customer_reviews.text: this is my office chair. yep. my back has been hurting so much from my normal chair at work that i got desperate and bought an exercise ball to sit on instead so as to encourage more fluid movement in my spine, less static sitting. it really helps a lot and as a result i'm overall in a lot less pain sitting on this than a standard office chair. so some intricacies of this thing... blow it up for the first time and then sit on it. the material needs to stretch a bit. then the next day readjust the inflation. i needed to add more air to mine. then i overdid it. great value.
customer_reviews.author: Fabulox

customer_reviews.title: 55 CM BALL 5'3 130 LBS Works well for me!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this ball for a little over a week. I have no complaints. I use it to sit at my desk for work, and also to workout. It was not difficult to inflate. Shipping was quick. Also, it doesn't feel "thin" or "cheap". For reference I am 5'3, 130 lbs, and ordered the 55cm. At first I thought it was too small, but after using it to workout it felt natural. Like maybe I've been using too large of a ball in the past! It also puts me at a nice height when using at my desk. Seems quite nice for the price!
customer_reviews.author: LAUREN

customer_reviews.title: Good, cheap, but inaccurate color portayal
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a red 65cm ball. It was a decent experience, but: - the ball needs to be inflated until it’s quite hard to reach 65cm — UPDATE: after five months, I can say that the ball relaxed considerably after about a week of sitting on it. Now it’s not very hard at 65cm - the color is very pinkish, not the bright red pictures - the equator seam has rubber threads hanging off it from the molding process. No big deal to take care of
customer_reviews.author: Julius

customer_reviews.title: Take a long time to fill up.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly as birth ball for this doula. Only giving it four starts because it does take a long time to fill up and is quite labor (no pun intended) intensive, which can be annoying in a birth situation. I've actually just ended up keeping it inflated because of these but it is annoying to transport from birth to birth. Overall, it's a great ball and stays well inflated. It doesn't have a yucky small and the material isn't loud and annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Em. K

customer_reviews.title: Product received as expected
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to add to my home equipment given our Stay In Place situation. Product inflated as expected with hand pump. Seems sturdy and as expected. Odd that I received an upgrade offer to a Lifetime Warranty but didn't find that option when registering at the URL mentioned in the enclosed packaging. We'll see what happens with the confirmation email if it contains the mention however right now looks like only 1 year warranty even after registration.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Schaller

product_meta.title: URBNFit Exercise Ball (Multiple Sizes) for Fitness, Stability, Balance & Yoga - Workout Guide & Quick Pump Included - Anti Burst Professional Quality Design
feature_bullets: ANTI BURST & SLIP EXERCISE BALL: Built with professional quality PVC material, our anti-burst workout ball can stand up to the most rigorous workouts up to 2000 lbs - all while preventing you from slipping off!
VARIETY OF USES: Excellent for yoga, pilates, and stretching exercises at home, in the gym, or the office! Also great to relief back pain, during pregnancy, and for improving your posture.

QUICK & EASY SETUP: Included is a quick, dual action inflation pump to easily and quickly inflate the balance ball. Your stability ball is delivered deflated and can be pumped up in minutes with minimal effort

THE PERFECT GIFT ITEM: Comes in retail ready box with detailed instructions, 2 air stoppers, and a workout guide! Great for a co-worker, friend, or family member who enjoys physical fitness and stability!
CUSTOMER SATISFACTION: We 100% stand behind our product! If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to contact us at any time and we will do our best to help!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
